name: Beer Hoarder - Limited Edition Craft Beer Print
description:
Beer Hoarder. An epic poster of beer epic-ness for the craft beer hoarder in all of us.

If you are into craft beer at all, you know one. You might actually BE one. Scooping up rare bottles at beer events. Stalking your local bottle shop for the next release. Waiting in lines for beer, like some perverse Soviet-era throwback. All to take your precious down to your basement, garage, cupboard, or cardboard box to let that bad boy get some age on it. Develop the funk. Yep, you're a beer hoarder.

Huge 17 x 22 limited edition print of watercolored rare and collectable beer bottles. True beer lovers can name all 42 of them. This limited edition of 100 is printed on thick, textured, 100% cotton paper. The paper brings to life the vivid watercolors, making this appear as if it was an original painting. Signed and numbered.

Absolutely ideal for the beer hoarder in your life. 

Print is not framed. Delivered rolled in a bend-proof kraft tube via USPS Priority Mail or First Class International.

Â© 2013 Alyson Thomas

name: Food Lovers Christmas Carol Holiday Cards - Set of 6
description:
The holidays revolve around food, and not surprisingly, so do Christmas carols. This set of cards feature six festive foods mentioned in classic Christmas tunes. The inside of each card has the printed lyrics. So very perfect for the food lovers in your life this holiday season.

You've got yer:

Figgy Pudding (from "We Wish You a Merry Christmas")
Chestnuts (from "Sleigh Ride")
Wassail (from "Here We Go A'wassailing")
Coffee and Pumpkin Pie (from "Sleigh Ride")
Popcorn (from "Let It Snow") 
Half a Drink (from the only slightly-creepy "Baby, It's Cold Outside")

Set of 6 cards and 6 cherry-red envelopes, each with printed version of my original watercolor illustrations. One of each: Figgy Pudding, Roast Chestnuts, Wassail, Half a Drink, Popcorn, and Coffee + Pumpkin Pie. Each card measures approximately 4 x 6 inches. Wrapped in butchers twine for extra points. 

Shipped flat in a bendproof fiberboard mailer.

name: Bloody Mary Cocktail Print
description:
Breakfast of champions. Well, likely hungover champions anyways. The zippy combo of spicy tomato juice and vodka will get you back on your feet, or at least get you through brunch. Garnish permutations on this one are endless, so we stuck with the classic, regal celery stick. 

Print of an original watercolor and ink painting of a bloody mary.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar.

Print is signed and shipped flat in protective cello bag and bend proof fiberboard mailer.

Thanks for looking!

name: Margarita Cocktail Print
description:
The most famous of famous tequila cocktails. Seriously, who doesn't love a good margarita? My vote goes for on the rocks with salt, so that's what I drew. But frozen ones are ok, I guess.

Print of an original watercolor and ink painting of a margarita.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar.

Print is signed and shipped flat in protective cello bag and bend proof fiberboard mailer.

Thanks for looking!

name: Whiskey Sour Cocktail Print
description:
Dead simple and oh so tasty. Lemon juice, sugar, whiskey (rye is the best, but anything will do in a pinch). Plop in a cherry if you are feeling fancy. Bam. You've got yourself a whiskey sour and the beginnings of a lovely evening. 

Print of an original watercolor and ink painting.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar.

Print is signed and shipped flat in protective cello bag and bend proof fiberboard mailer.

Thanks for looking!

name: Paloma Cocktail Print
description:
Less well known than that other tequila cocktail, but every bit as refreshing is the Paloma. In the traditional version of this Mexican treat, grapefruit soda (Jarritos, por supuesto) is mixed with lime and tequila in a salt-rimmed glass. Amp it up by subbing fresh grapefruit juice, simple syrup and sparkling water for the grapefruit soda. 

Print of an original watercolor and ink painting.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar.

Print is signed and shipped flat in protective cello bag and bend proof fiberboard mailer.

Thanks for looking!

name: Mojito Cocktail Print
description:
Another favorite of Mr. Hemingway, this minty rum treat is undeniably refreshing. Just don't order 10 of them on a Friday night at your favorite crowded bar. Bartenders hate that. 

Print of an original watercolor and ink painting.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar.

Print is signed and shipped flat in protective cello bag and bend proof fiberboard mailer.

name: Use Every Part - Cow Butchery Diagram Poster
description:
Cows are complicated, both meat-wise and emotionally. Let me help you figure them out.

This is a 13 x19 poster of my original gouache and acrylic painting. I *extensively* researched retails cuts of beef to fully flesh out what primal cut part of the cow they come from. The result is a both a highly accurate and informative diagram, as well as a bold and colorful piece of art. I've even had culinary students buy this piece to study.

Print measures 13 x 19 inches, which is a standard frame size. The reproduction is of very high quality; many mistake it for an original since you can see much of the original paint texture.

This is perfect for decorating your kitchen or as a gift for your favorite food lover or chef.

Printed with archival inks on acid-free heavyweight archival paper.

Shipped rolled in sturdy tubes, via USPS First Class. Multiple poster orders can be shipped in the same tube, and I'll refund the extra shipping charges via Paypal.

Â© 2011 - 2012 Alyson Thomas

name: San Francisco is For Carnivores
description:
San Francisco neighborhood map in a pig poster.

Forget the hippies, vegans, and "Meatless Mondays" - San Francisco is for Carnivores.

This is a 13x19 poster of a hand-drawn map of San Francisco neighborhoods, in the form of a pig butchery diagram. In addition to the neighborhoods, there are some pig parts diagrammed, like hocks, ham, ear, etc.

yes, freaking awesome.

Measures 13x19. Red pig with red text, on a cream colored background. Printed with archival inks on heavy-weight acid-free archival paper.

This poster is the same size as the famous Filmore posters, so any frame shop in SF should carry the correct sized frame.

Shipped rolled in tubes, via USPS First Class. Multiple poster orders can be shipped in the same tube, and I'll refund the extra shipping charges via Paypal.

Thanks so much for looking!!

This is a 13 x19 poster print of my original gouache and acrylic painting. I *extensively* researched retails cuts of pork to fully flesh out what primal cut part of the pig they come from. 

All of my prints are of my own original drawings, illustrations, and paintings. No stock images or computer generated imagery here -- just unique, accurate, and oh so meaty art. The result is a both a highly accurate and informative diagram, as well as a bold and colorful piece of art.

name: Negroni Cocktail Print
description: The classic bitter sweet cocktail....the negroni. Stronger than an Americano, but still a delicious before-dinner drink. Bracing and bitter from the Campari, sweet from vermouth and the kick from gin. Print measures 8.5 x 11, vertical, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar. This guy also looks great in a set with any of the other cocktail diagrams, like the Old Fashioned, Manhattan, Boulevardier, and Mint Julep. Print is signed and shipped flat in protective cello bag and bend proof fiberboard mailer. Thanks for looking! Â© 2012 - 2013 Alyson Thomas

name: Manhattan Cocktail Diagram Print
description: Drink up, it's a classic Manhattan. Technically, a traditional Manhattan is actually made with rye, but I wouldn't kick a bourbon Manhattan out of bed. name: Cocktail Diagram Tea Towel
description:
Quite possibly the ultimate bar towel. 

Sixteen cocktails, complete with diagrammed ingredients. All hand-drawn and printed onto a natural, unbleached cotton tea towel. Machine washable and lint-free. All you could want and more. 

Towel measures approximately 27 x 25 inches. Image is screenprinted in the lower center, so all the cocktails are visible when you hang up your new towel. 

Cocktails diagrammed are : Mojito, Margarita, Moscow Mule, Mint Julep, Sidecar, Paloma, Martini, Corpse Reviver #2, Vieux Carre, Manhattan, Whiskey Sour, Jack Rose, Pisco Sour, Old Fashioned, Negroni, and Sazerac.

There are some variations, textures, and nubs in the towel material, which just adds to the charm. 

Shipped in plastic mailer via USPS First Class. 

Â© 2013 Alyson Thomas

name: Chicago Hot Dog

Chicago's iconic contribution to the "meat in tube" art form -- the Chicago hot dog.

This is a pretty awesome print of an original watercolor painting of a blown out Chicago hot dog in all its glory (and with all its toppings). No ketchup, obviously.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. name: Guanciale Me Maybe  Meat Print
description:
For that person who likes Italian pork jowl just as much as you like cheesy pop music. This is for you.

Guanciale is cured, unsmoked pork jowl from Italy. Traditionally used in carbonara, bacon is often used as a substitute. But the pork jowl is really where it is at. 

Print of an original watercolor and ink painting. Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Each print is signed by the artist. 

Print is signed and shipped flat in protective cello bag and bend proof fiberboard mailer.

name: Old Fashioned Cocktail Print
description: One of the classic "mother" cocktails of history. Keep the orange juice and maraschino cherries out of this beauty. Just bourbon, sugar, and bitters, with a citrus rind to brighten it up. Fun fact: the old fashioned glass is named after the cocktails. Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar. name: Aviation Cocktail Diagram
description:
My first time with an Aviation went like this: "What is this alluring blue grey cocktail before me? Oh, it's delicious!:" This well-balanced drink combines gin, lemon juice and maraschino liqueur (the real stuff...not from  your average neon sundae toppers). The weird color, courtesy of a bit of Creme de Violette. How fancy.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar.

This is a pretty awesome print of an original watercolor painting of a nice smoked, dry rubbed barbecue rib, complete with smoke ring. Part of my 21- part series of "cheeky meat" paintings, this can work as well in the kitchen as it would framed in the bedroom. Or wherever, really.

name: French 75 Cocktail Diagram Print
description:
Class up that boring glass of bubbles and make a French 75.

A splash of gin, sugar, and lemon elevates champagne into this lovely early 20th-century tipple. Invented in Paris in 1915, it is named after the French 75mm field gun, presumably since it packs such a sneaky wallop. 

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. Great for your home bar.

name: Regional American Barbeque Venn Diagram Poster
description:
Barbecue country is serious. Ever want to know the difference between Memphis and South Carolina barbeque? What about western North Carolina vs. eastern North Carolina. It's all down to the meat and sauce.

This is a signed 13 x19 poster of my original watercolor and ink infographic painting. I *extensively* researched the meat and sauce variations prominent in the BBQ traditions of different American regions. The result is a crazy awesome and instructive Venn diagram of American barbecue (aka "Venn-B-Que"),  as well as a bold and colorful piece of art.  Where the meat and sauce intersect, the correct region of BBQ is displayed.

Print measures 13 x 19 inches, which is a standard frame size. The reproduction is of very high quality; many mistake it for an original since you can see much of the original paint texture. 

This is perfect for the barbecue fanatic. 

Printed with archival inks on acid-free heavyweight archival paper. Every print is signed by the artist.

name: San Francisco is For Carnivores - T shirt
description:
You are awesome. You love pork. You love San Francisco. Let everyone know.

The ever-popular, "San Francisco is for Carnivores" poster, featuring a San Francisco neighborhood map in a pig butchery diagram, is now available as a t shirt!

Image is screen-printed in cardinal red ink on a natural, off-white American Apparel unisex t-shirt. They are super cool. As you probably know, American Apparel shirts are slim cut, and run on the small size. Please check out the sizing chart before ordering, as I cannot accept returns of T-shirts for sizing issues. http://www.americanapparel.net/sizing/default.asp?chart=mu.shirts

*note, the list of neighborhoods and pig parts as on the poster \ are not included on the shirt design. It's more subtle, but cool locals will definitely "get it".*

Shipped in a protective t shirt bag.

Thanks for looking!!

name: Know What You Drink - Detailed Beer Diagram Poster
description:
Fancy yourself a beer nerd? This is your poster. Though beer may just be water, malts, hops, and yeast, there's a lot more to it than that.

This is a 13 x19 poster of my original gouache and acrylic painting. I *extensively* documented the varieties of each of the primary beer ingredients - malt, water, hops, and yeast, and highlighted the most important ones in this handy poster. The result is a both a highly accurate and informative diagram, as well as a bold and colorful piece of art.

This is perfect for decorating your kitchen, bar, or home-brew area. It's also a great gift for your favorite beer nerd.

Printed with archival inks on acid-free heavyweight archival paper.

Shipped rolled in sturdy tubes, via USPS First Class. Multiple poster orders can be shipped in the same tube, and I'll refund the extra shipping charges via Paypal.

Image is screen-printed in white ink on a heather black American Apparel unisex 50/50 t-shirt. (50% cotton, 50% polyester). They are super cool. Printed with one pass of white ink, so the image is slightly transparent. On the heathered black shirt, it almost looks chalkboard-like.

name: Boulevardier Cocktail Print

Print measures 8.5 x 11, vertically oriented,and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. name: A Peek Inside a Haggis
description:
Yep, the granddaddy of Scottish cuisine, grossing out foreigners for centuries. It's Haggis. Take a sheep's stomach, and stuff it full of goodies, like that sheep's pluck (lung, liver, and heart), oatmeal, and spices. Mmmmmm.

"Fair fa' your honest, sonsie face, Great chieftain o' the puddin-race!" - 'Address to a Haggis', by Robert Burns

Perfect for the Scotman in your life. Present it to him on Burns Day.

This is a print of an original watercolor painting of a haggis. Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. The quality is pretty amazing, and is often mistaken for an original. name: I Like Big Butts - Archival Pork Print
description:
And I cannot lie.

This is a print of an original watercolor painting of pork butt. Here's a little PSA -- pork butt (aka Boston Butt) is NOT from the pig's rear. It is the top of the shoulder. There isn't really a clear consensus on WHY it is called a butt, but some historians believe it has to do with the colonial American practice of storing this cheap cut of pork in large casks or barrels (also known as "butts").

Hat tip to the one and only Sir-Mix-A-Lot for the classic caption.

Part of my 19-part series of "cheeky meat" paintings, this can work as well in the kitchen as it would framed in the bedroom. Or wherever, really.

Print measures 8.5 x 11, and is printed with archival pigment inks on archival velvet fine art paper. The paper is slightly textured, like watercolor paper. description:

Hat tip to the one and only Sir-Mix-A-Lot for the classic caption.

This is a 13 x19 poster of my original gouache and acrylic painting. I *extensively* researched retail cuts of chicken to fully flesh out what primal cut part of the chicken they come from. The result is a both a highly accurate and informative diagram, as well as a bold and colorful piece of art.

Print measures 13 x 19 inches, which is a standard frame size. The reproduction is of very high quality; many mistake it for an original since you can see much of the original paint texture.

This is perfect for decorating your kitchen or as a gift for your favorite food lover or chef.

name: Brooklyn Knows the Tastiest Part
description:
Brooklyn neighborhood map in a pig butchery diagram poster. Third in the "Meat My City" poster series.

What? You don't know how tasty pig ears are? The trotters? Kosher bacon? What, are you vegan or something? Oh, you must not live in Brooklyn. Land of old and new-school butchers, whole hog butchery classes, and sustainable local meat.

This is a poster of a hand-drawn map of Brooklyn neighborhoods, in the form of a pig butchery diagram. In addition to the neighborhoods, there are some pig parts diagrammed, like fatback, ham, jowl, kosher bacon (super secret Brooklyn part) etc. Also includes the historic Pigtown neighborhood, because, you know, it's pretty amazing, right?

yes, freaking awesome.

Measures 13x19, with an approximately 1/4 inch white border. Reddish/coral colored pig with dark grey text, on a fleshy pink background. Printed with archival pigment inks on 195gsm premium matte paper.

â¢ â¢ â¢ 10% of each poster sale price will be donated to the St John's Bread and Life food pantry, located in Brooklyn â¢ â¢ â¢

Shipped rolled in a cardboard mailing tube, via USPS First Class.

Multiple poster orders can be shipped in the same tube, and I'll refund the extra shipping charges via Paypal.

Â© 2010 - 2012 Alyson Thomas. 

Thanks so much for looking!!

name: Seattle Eats Local
description:
Seattle neighborhood map in a salmon poster. Second in the "Meat My City" poster series.

Farm-raised salmon? I don't think so. Seattle eats local. And awesomely.

This is a poster of a hand-drawn map of Seattle neighborhoods, in the form of a salmon butchery diagram. In addition to the neighborhoods, there are some salmon parts diagrammed, like dorsal fin, head, belly, jowl (ahem...)etc.

yes, freaking awesome.

Measures 13x19, with an approximately 1/4 inch white border. Salmon colored salmon (obv.) with darker cedar plank salmon text, on a cream colored background. (The first picture is not an accurate representation of the background color. It is a warm cream, as seen in the other pics). Printed with archival pigment inks on 195gsm premium matte paper.

â¢ â¢ â¢ 10 % of poster purchase price will be donated to the Northwest Harvest food bank in Washington State â¢ â¢ â¢

Shipped rolled in a cardboard mailing tube via USPS First Class. Multiple poster orders can be shipped in the same tube, and I'll refund the extra shipping charges via Paypal.

name: Portland Knows How to Pork
description:
Portland neighborhood map in a pig butchery diagram poster. Put a pig on it. 

Portland may be known as a veggie-friendly city, but meat-eaters there know that Portland really knows how to pork. Especially if it's a heritage breed, woodland-raised, hyper-local, organic acorn-fed, use-it-all-nose-to-tail pig (named Fred).

This is a poster of a hand-drawn map of Portland neighborhoods, in the form of a pig butchery diagram. In addition to the (MANY!) neighborhoods, there are some porky cuts of pig diagrammed, like ham, jowl, secret bacon, etc.

yes, freaking awesome.

Measures 13x19, with an approximately 1/4 inch white border. Warm red pig with dark red text, on a mustard yellow background. Printed with archival pigment inks on 195gsm premium matte paper.

â¢ â¢ â¢ 10% of each poster sale price will be donated to the Oregon Food Bank â¢ â¢ â¢

Shipped rolled in a cardboard mailing tube, via USPS First Class.

Multiple poster orders can be shipped in the same tube, and I'll refund the extra shipping charges via Paypal.

Thanks so much for looking!!

name: Los Angeles is for Meat Eaters
description:
Los Angeles neighborhood map in a pig poster.

The boobs there may be fake, but the meat, it's all natural, baby. Whether at a Hollywood steakhouse where the elite meat, at a sustainable butcher shop where your pork was the one on an organic diet, or inside your taco, Los Angeles is for meat eaters.

This 13x19 poster is of a hand-drawn map of the MANY neighborhoods of Los Angeles, in the form of a pig butchery diagram. In addition to the neighborhoods, there are some pig parts diagrammed, like hocks, ham, ear, etc.

yes, freaking awesome.

Measures 13x19. Reddish/coral pig with charcoal text, on a silvery grey background. Printed with archival inks on heavyweight archival paper.

Shipped rolled in tubes, via USPS First Class. Multiple poster orders can be shipped in the same tube, and I'll refund the extra shipping charges via Paypal.

â¢ â¢ â¢ 10% of poster purchase price will be donated to the Los Angeles Regional Food Bank, where they will be able to distribute $12.50 worth of food for each poster sold! â¢ â¢ â¢
